abstract: Discovery of the UPS and FedEx bombs raises the possibility of large new costs to inspect goods being shipped across national frontiers. Such spending could effectively become a new “terror trade tax,” and be championed by protectionist politicians.
snippet: Discovery of the UPS and FedEx bombs raises the possibility of large new costs to inspect goods being shipped across national frontiers. Such spending could effectively become a new “terror trade tax,” and be championed by protectionist politician...
lead_paragraph: The disclosure that the two bombs from Yemen may have been intended to blow up cargo planes over the ocean raises the possibility of pressure for a new round of spending that will be a drag on world trade and the world economy, even if it is deemed necessary.
